8ukr0rvJqnHVf6tVHWAmzg.text: Very good pho and spring rolls. Service was also very good for carryout and they accepted credit card as payment.

821FChXd-aYKOPbhjaJ8yg.text: The eggrolls here are deeelish. The pho has pretty good flavor as well...but I didn't like the honey chicken.

6-ypbDqzGxW8ItzOOkC59g.text: Food was alright. Service hit or miss. One guy was excellent, the other was sub par. He brought us the check before we even got the food?? What the heck? When he realized we didn't even get our food yet, he took the bill back.   Anyways, I got the tomato soup with escargot (bun rieu oc). Took forever to come out and when it did, there was no escargot in it! I asked them about it and they told me they would bring some out. A few minutes later, I got a little bowl of escargot, put it in my soup... Only to find out it was still cold! I bit into the center and all I tasted was cold chewy nastiness :( I kept it in my soup but at this time, the broth was no longer hot enough to warm up the little snails. The broth was also not that great. The top layer was extremely oily and hard to avoid with each bite.

snqV6uyM881ESjvX2rTHnQ.text: it's been awhile since we've been back here. I have to say, they are truly stepping up their game. The bowls are much bigger than they used to be so you definitely get more for your money. The service is good, hopefully remains consistent even when they are busy. The soup is as flavorful as i remember it to be. I'm happy we came back here. I will be back more often after this trip

E4vIJwhwUgdSGParms08tA.text: I would give this place zero stars. Beware of this place they have been on dirty dining. Yuck!!!!

dUCAMoV_ssLPuHFjZaoMqQ.text: Best Vietnamese out there! I always get the broken rice pork skewers, best flavor ever, no need to add any extra seasoning.  I love the atmosphere, the servers are so nice and recognize me every time I go in.

S6VU0AoPoDNkFl3rja43dg.text: Jennie Pho is my go to pho place when I visit Vegas. Good food, quick friendly service. Good selection on menu. I usually get the P1 Jennie Pho and some egg rolls. Love it all the time and so affordable.

85hJaMk9GCD-ExqhcpCXzQ.text: Not the best sevice i've been offered. But I like this place's pho the best. I like that it has less smell of whatever it is in the usual pho. Clean taste of soup, lots of meats, and noodles. Noodle is usually overcooked but it is better than being undercooked.  I love their egg rolls too. Great place to try pho if it's your first one.

qsTX7rAlhe5erjGVTMX_eA.text: This was my first experience trying Pho, and I was pleasantly surprised. I had ordered the steak Pho and a plain ice tea. For $7.95 you get a plate of basil, jalapenos, and bean sprouts with your Pho. The broth was flavorful, and the meat was very tender. The steak came thinly sliced, and there was just the right amount of it in the soup. The noodles were translucent and also had a nice texture. All in all, the food great and I will soon be going back for seconds.   Cons: Yes, this place accepts cash only. Also, they don't refill drink in a timely manner.  Other than that, Jenni Pho is a great place to dine:)

R4Z4_fc_QruukbdvfRm1Ew.text: Love the traditional jennipho. Make sure you get yourself the super size to make it worth it. Love eating at this place, especially because the taste of the food is great. Every time I come to Las Vegas I don't mind driving to this

2aU9lqfLXh28keqDoF8wGQ.text: I used to hardly come here, despite the good food, because they didn't take credit cards. Then for a while they were taking credit cards but with a $15 minimum, which of course is more than the cost of a meal. Now they take credit cards with no minimum!  Really good pho here. The broth is great; my heart breaks a little every time I see someone dump hoisin and sriracha into their bowl. You're ruining the broth! Those are for dipping!  The beef stew is great, too. I haven't tried the bun bo hue here, but I will order it with confidence if I'm craving it when I visit.  As a unique item, they also have a lobster pho. It's not the crazy whole, fresh lobster in the bowl like you'll get at District One, but for that you'll pay like sixty bucks. This is a lobster tail, and it's only $15 and comes with a free iced tea. I tried it once and enjoyed it a lot.  One problem: one night at around 9 I saw one of the women going around to the tables, topping off the condiment bottles. Not good! How old is some of the sauce in those bottles?? As old as the restaurant?! This isn't just icky, it's a health code violation.  That aside, even with all the good pho places in this neighborhood, Jenni deserves a spot on the pho rotation.

photos.caption: Photo of Jenni Pho - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pho.

nRgZuUZYEr1Wbk7fJlZ3Qw.text: My honey and I came here yesterday because we were hungry after the gym and I was craving a soup-y meal  and man did it hit the spot!  Upon walking in, the staff at the counter greeted us and seated us immediately. You can tell this place is a homey place because of the way the employees interact with their customers. I was indecisive between the pho dac biet (basically the pho special with everything in it) or the bun bo hue (a special blend of spices to create an extremely savory soup) and decided to try their bun bo hue.   What I liked about it was the flavor of the soup- nice, rich and flavorful. It kind of reminds me of a bit of lemongrass with pork broth and a few other spices that I can't quite put my finger on. The bowl was large with a lot of noodles, a pork hock, Vietnamese meat loaf slices, slices of meat and slices of coagulated pork blood. I know, I know, it sounds gross but honestly, don't knock it till you try it. It tastes good especially with all the fresh crunchy veggies added to the soup to add a different level of texture. What I wish was a bit better was the depth of flavor- I feel like the soup was delicious but it could have been kicked up a notch a bit more.   My honey got the honey chicken with broken rice and it was yummy as well. It was char grilled chicken with fresh green onions on top of it and a heaping pile of broken rice with slices of fresh crisp cucumbers, tomato and carrots.  All in all, I am definitely coming back here to try more of their foods because it was delicious and it definitely hit the spot!

bh6THgDWroQ6n0E5hNHWaw.text: Im sad I didnt take pictures!! But anyways, I enjoyed this place.  The portion here is massive for the regular.  We got here around 7 pm on a Thursday and it was empty. They also have a kids pho which comes with coke or sprite.  It was weird though that the adults got the food before the kids.  I just believe it should be the other way around? Anyways, the broth had flavor and wasnt watered down or anything and was great.  The pho came with a big plate of veggies to accompany your soup.  I was sad that there was no culantro which is the first time ever in a pho restaurant not having it.    Other than that, service was good & food was good! The price also was reasonable and we had a pleasent experience.

The rangoons were lightly fried with hot cream cheese. Delicious and savory. The pho I ordered was so delectable I  sat for a moment to appreciate the flavor blend. The soup wasn't salty, and the the noodles were soft. The shrimp tasted clean. I dislike when shrimp has a shady taste at some pho spots. If you spend more than twenty dollars, you get complimentary ice cream! The service was on point as well! This is my favorite pho spot in Vegas.  Pros: great service, clean utensils, clean tables, restrooms, new menu, easy parking, inexpensive, no wait time for seats, apple pay  Cons: no wifi  Overall: Still my favorite pho spot in the city!

BA8H4eo-R4Y2YUZuMRWCoQ.text: Our family is an original owner within the nearby Nevada Trails tract. I remember when Jenni Pho first opened--when the shopping center, housing it, was built. So why wait until now to write a review?   Back then, I figured Jenni Pho wasn't a "destination" and would only be of interest to residents in the vicinity. But in the past 14 years, the area has developed more residential and commercial--and other Vietnamese restaurants have opened nearby.   One of the nice things about Jenni Pho is the physical layout. Jenni Pho is within a freestanding building. It occupies its own "pad"--not a "shoebox" unit within a strip mall. This means that they have a lot more window area, and more natural light. It also allows them to have an "open kitchen". (Frankly, there isn't much to see inside the kitchen--but it requires them to maintain "good optics" for public viewing.) The decor isn't fancy, but it is nice; the colors are neutral and relaxing.  The seating isn't plush, but it is comfortable.   Frankly, I haven't eaten anything on the menu other than bowls of pho. But this is probably the most frequently ordered meal.   Through the years, I have found the food quality to be consistent. Meal portions are good, relative to the price. But what I appreciate most is the soup. One of my personal peeves is that many pho shops provide broth that is either too salty, too sweet, or both. The broth provided by Jenni Pho is just right--such that I can actually drink the soup as well as eat the noodles.   It's nice to have a number of Vietnamese restaurants nearby, for variety. But it's also nice to understand why I tend to frequent Jenni Pho more often than the others.

jATywdShKpVaWquK64xxdg.text: Vietnamese food remains a novelty in the southwest area of Las Vegas.  With the recent opening of Jenni Pho, it satisfies your basic pho desires.  Jenni Pho is a clean restaurant with an open kitchen viewable through the glass window, something you don't see often in Vietnamese establishments.  Their menu is quite limited (versus others), focusing on a handful of pho bowls, broken rice dishes, stir fried noodles, and cold noodle bowls.  They also offer boba and slushed ice drinks.  And yes, it's a bit more expensive than Spring Mountain restaurants.  I've been here a few times, sticking to the pho dishes.  Most recently I ordered the "Create Your Own Bowl" for $6.95.  You can choose  up to five items among 8 for your own combo.  I went for the fatty flank, steak, meat balls, crunchy flank, and tripe.  (The other three are brisket, tendon, and flank.)  They only have one size available, which is a cross between the small and large in other restaurants.   The Husband ordered the Bo Kho (Beef Stew Noodle Soup) for $7.50.  He asked for egg noodles, which costs a dollar more.  When we actually got the bowl, regular rice noodles were there.  We told the waitress and she offered to take it back and change out the noodles but we were hungry and didn't want to wait.  We just wanted to be sure we weren't charged for the noodle change that didn't happen.  They do offer a decent amount of noodles and meat in their version.    Overall, Jenni Pho has had a steady stream of customers when we visit.  And we notice non-Vietnamese frequenting as well, which I account for their picture menu making lives a bit easier.  It's a bit more relaxed here though, like a leisurely meal taking place.  It works when you're craving basic Vietnamese food in the area.  Cash only.  (Pics posted!)

-iTe6BKA7tj_vxTXSBOCSg.text: This is quickly rising to the top of our favorite pho places.  Our third visit today and we took 2 pho newbies along for a food adventure.    It did not disappoint. There is an amazing young waiter here too, forgot his name (sorry)...but he always takes care of us and is really cordial. Yesterday instead if coconut water we got the green apple iced tea and Papaya milk tea! Both were so good! Must try if you're into those kinds of drinks :)  only sad thing is they only accept cash! Get a square reader or something for visa Amex MasterCard :)!

ORuZa8DAaNZp7cNXNjHvgQ.text: Service was good and the wait is not too bad. The food is okay, nothing too impressive about though. Pretty standard viet pho place. I think the one on spring mountain is slightly better.

Ya9xfbn9u_dGjhsTCt1kUA.text: I love the fact that they have buy one get one going on for their pot-stickers. I'm a huge fan of them. Their Pho was pretty OK.  3 star because of the service. They don't really have very attentive servers.   Casual ambience. cool set up.  will go there again for pot-stickers.

8GIzaSOSdoLU9KFtagfYpA.text: Love this place.  The steak and flank with an over easy egg is the bomb!!  Plus they make great pot stickers!!

VGBbHyALwIrVuYmgIpYEOA.text: The food has the potential to be awesome if you can get a server to pay attention to how you want things done.

9wZnhDM8cxXqWUfb__PXcA.text: I ate here about two weeks ago at the last minute. I ordered the pho with vegetables and tofu only. It came out marginally hot. It looked sketchy and I was surprised I didn't get sick.  What turns me off about this place is that it's cash only. It reminded me of another pho place I went to that had no sign that there was a debit card minimum. Since I had no cash, they pointed me to an ATM onsite that charged a fee and was owned by the restaurant. How convenient. Do all Pho places run like this?

th5km-Q1Yzm3sp078_I3ng.text: Ordered soup and shrimp spring rolls. Told them two separate times no pig blood in my soup. I get home to find it's full of pork blood. I ended up throwing the soup out because they were closed by the time I got to the soup, waste of money. If you look at the shrimp in the spring rolls it looks impressive but when you take a bite you discover the shrimp is sliced so thin that you can barely taste it. You pay almost $6 for two rolled up lettuce and noodle rolls.

Sew41t0qLOTQsOwKieX88w.text: Delicious pho and beef stew noodle soup. We've been here at least 10 times.

8knSbsjYqbxRSejCci2-dA.text: The food was ok.. Serving size was good but the service was horrible. Maybe it was because I was with a big group but everyone had to switch plates. I was happy to see there was an alternate option for kids. I'll stick to my other spot in china town..

rJ8dAV_SWbZspJmEK3VMIw.text: When you're in the mood for some warm soup and noodles, pho is the go to food. When you want warm delicious soup and noodles, Jenni Pho is the go to place. Its a small establishment between Spring Valley and Enterprise. They have the most flavorsome broths in town. They set you up with separate sides so you can decide what you would like to add to your soup. I got the shrimp pho and oh my taste buds. There was so much warmness and deliciousness in that big bowl of pho. I couldn't help but finish the entire bowl. I definitely need to get back here during winter time when its extremely cold. My friends also tried the grilled honey chicken which her boys enjoyed. My kid ordered the chicken strips which she liked a lot.

xekXKa-8OAr0R-5Smzz6-g.text: Excellent service Steven & Tyler.  (Easy enough to remember.. Steven Tyler lol)  Everyone was friendly & worked together like family.  Everything was clean & you can see into the kitchen clearly.  Friends last minute b-day Pho request.  Ordered the Tofu, Pork & the Shrimp Spring Rolls since we have Vegan friends too & Jenni Pho was very accommodating.  All of the veggies & shrimp were fresh & a nice lite way to start before our filling Pho.  The pork tasted & looked more like a Spam Spring Roll to me, & recommend the delicious Tofu Spring Roll over it!  One Vegan Pho w/ Tomato broth, different & very tasty!  The Beef Pho & Chicken Pho were surprisingly delish to me because I have become a 'Pho snob.'  Lol!  I usually eat at two Pho spots regularly that no other compare to.  My white meat chicken was tender, but needed a couple more pieces even though it's a large portion of Pho.  The side veggies of basil, sprouts, jalapeno, lime, etc were fresh & abundant.  All sauces & chopsticks already on the table, not the soup spoons.    Not big on Boba drinks since they are also filling before Pho & I don't eat the tapioca balls, but I like the authenticity having them here if I do want one, usually on a hot day.    They do not serve alcoholic beverages or sparkling water.

The egg rolls were a bit sad...skinny and not too flavorful.   I'll be sure to come back and try their pho again.

HePf4M2m-5a1TIR84itRyQ.text: Staff and menu lied about content. I paid extra for what was labeled "crunchy flank".. I asked the hostess if it was flank steak and she said yes flank steak... when I got home and opened the container they gave me TONGUE!!!! ezciRhfNK8j8-neGi3lDiQ.text: FOOD: Food tasted really good.   I got a plate of pork, rice, and veggies.  My girlfriend got a bowl of Pho with steak and flank, and enjoyed it.  We both come here every once in a while to satisfy our vietnamese food cravings, and it doesn't disappoint.  2 meals, more than enough to satisfy with the portions. $21. Not bad.  SERVICE: The staff is very courteous and friendly. They forgot our bean sprouts platter for our Pho, and special soup spoon for the broth. We let the staff know, and they apologized and quickly gave us what we needed. One of the staff (I'm not sure if she's the manager, but looks to be) even gave me a small bowl of broth to enjoy alongside with my rice platter as a way to say sorry for the mistakes. I gladly accepted. The broth was great, and I appreciate the gesture!   It's fine to forget small things, as long as they quickly resolve them. Very friendly! Leave a tip for them. Kept our water cups filled.  VERIDICT: There is probably a place with better cuisine, especially in a place like Las Vegas. But if you are anywhere near the South side, this place doesn't disappoint. Good food, and friendly staff. If you're near, give it a try.

ojKKHO0iDmwlJsG_lnmREg.text: There are a lot of places you can go for Pho but this place is my go to. The service is wonderful and detail oriented. Unlike other places if you get the shrimp pho here they take the time to serve you the pho with the shrimp tail off. It may sound like a small thing but for me I like that attention to detail. They also recently started offering delicious iced coffee, it was the perfect pick me up for the afternoon.

lZI0vhgvytGIiNFzyr4Hww.text: My husband and I both really enjoy this place. In fact, it's the best pho we've had so far in Vegas! The hostess is always so nice and the waitstaff is very attentive. XHtnX-Zjh9R37-m8cOXCMg.text: My favorite Vietnamese place to dine in or to go. Friendly staff & their food & drinks are delicious. I'm hooked on their vermicelli salad bowls. All three of their iced tea drinks are amazing! Try all three when you get a chance. Of course their Pho is the Best!

F3t4p3_rLScxey_e_UcF3Q.text: Food was decent, I've had better. This location is receiving just 2 stars because it's CASH ONLY. They have a small sign by the entrance where it's not a eye level to realize that they do not accept credit card!   They should have a bigger sign and as a customer service, BEFORE we ordered, possibly let us know it's CASH ONLY instead after I ate and ready to pay with credit card!!!!!!!!!!!   But I gave them a second star just because they let us leave with just a copy of our dr lic and to have us pay the next day.

9awhFurI-Gr__HrC4D37rA.text: The food is good, but it's cash only and freezing inside. I was told it is because they just opened and the heater was just turned on. Well, after 45 minutes the thermostat still says 49 degrees inside temperature and there is no heat coming out of any of the vents. I only came here because my normal pho place was not open. FWIW, their location on Spring Mountain is much better.

Xj3FmA-MdXQwtYQcm1XYcA.text: After a raucous night of art, hijinks and music, my friends and I were in need of a serious refuel. Some of our group were fiending for pho and this location was in extremely efficient proximity, so we ventured forth. Once seated, we got our rounds of icy cold water and debated over our orders. I opted for their beef special, which included various bits of beefy goodness including tendon, brisket and tripe. I ordered their blood cubes as an addition, which were surprisingly large once they arrived. I also ordered the green papaya salad for the table, which was alright. The salad included beef jerky, which was an interesting touch, though the dressing wasn't particularly noteworthy and a bit overly sweet for my tastes. The pho broth was alright, perhaps not as deep or nuanced as other places I've tried, and they brought ONE small plate of herbs for a table of five (and THREE of us had ordered pho). As soon as we finished and began filtering out, an older woman who worked there sat at our table and stared us down, making me rather uncomfortable.   Pros: convenient location for the area   Cons: creepy lady, lack of herbaceous goodness, underwelming salad, slightly elevated prices compared to other locations

nPHxJp5FsA75o_b9aP77Pg.text: My favorite pho place but service is really bad here... been here many times but this time was the worst. The husband only wanted dessert. On the menu they offer like 6 different desserts. They were "out" of all of them? They seemed very busy but a table that was seated after us (and had more people) was served before us? Not happy...

ex82V1SLYgsM6wLGHnDqZg.text: My wife saw a huge billboard for Jenni Pho.  She looked it up on google and we were off on our next lunch-scapade.    Funny thing, she chose the WRONG Jenni Pho.  There are two:  one at Rainbow and a new one at Spring Mountain.  Since we were at the Wynn, it would have been convenient to just swing by the new location; instead, we hiked out to Rainbow.  And, what a hike it is.  Jenni Pho is located in a compact complex.  Parking is atrocious! And, people in Vegas fail to drive within the rules.  One way means one way and not two way.  Once you see the lot, you will understand.  Restaurant is not that bad.  It is a bit tight walking in and there is very little room.  It seemed like they try to squeeze as many tables together as they can.  Also, to save on electricity, they left the front door open.  So, people sitting next to the front door had to suffer a noticeable cold breeze.  Note:  Since this is during the winter months, this is not good.   My wife and I both tried the Pho Dac Biet.  We have tasted better.  It lacked a lot of flavor.  It was kinda water down.  However, I think it was a new brew and it actually needed to "sit" (like 24 hours) for awhile before being served.  Also, the water was not hot or warm.  I think the noodles were cold and they put the brew on top.  The noodles cooled down the water and it made the meal less appealing.    Service was decent here.  Unlike many Viet establishments, service was very attentive and they were very nice.    Overall, I thought the service was good, price was "higher" compared to other vietnamese restaurant (not too much, but enough to notice), and food was below average on this occasion.  We still plan to give this another try.  Next time, we probably try the Spring Mountain location.  Cheers,

aBf194BnAi8M3isGngyoWQ.text: Jenni Pho is super convenient for me. It's right down the street. There are better Pho spots in town, but this one gets the job done. I always get the spring rolls with he peanut sauce. For a meal the rare steak pho is my favorite. If your in the neighborhood and you're looking for a quick pho fix, well than Jenni Pho will get the job done!!

fX5bPmkSgGcM8RPl46_QLw.text: I'm not really a fan of Vietnamese food, and definitely not a fan of pho.  Yes, I realize I could possibly be the only person who doesn't like pho, as it seems everyone else in the world loves it.  Anyhoozles...  My friend talked me into having lunch here because she likes their cold noodles.  I can't think of the name on the menu, but it's basically cold noodles similar to somen noodles, with lettuce, carrots and I got the one with egg rolls.  It was just OKAY.    However, I took my leftovers to go and ate it two days later, and it tasted WAY better than when I was eating there.  I think because the sauce had time to actually soak into the noodles so it had more flavor.  The thai iced tea boba was pretty good and there was a buy 2 get one free deal.    I probably wouldn't eat here again unless my friend dragged me back kicking and screaming. :(

UTXi28RekjI8KR7Th_CakQ.text: First place I ever had Pho, so I'm biased. But service is friendly always. Quick service.  Clean environment. Good price for good food. Cash only though, always have to stop at the bank before I go there. On a cold rainy night, this place hit the spot!

ktiu7R4v-azOVer52gFd3Q.text: A three star average is definitely an over-rating for this place. That's about all I can say. Good parking.

oKK9M-_g2gAkmijuG7pyBA.text: jenni pho has excellent customer service. All the waiters were very accommodating & sweet. xwzeAIKpC9t2ML1zkY_7Vg.text: My boyfriend and I come here all the time and get the pho Thai, 2 for 1 dumplings, and boba milk teas. We always love the servers and it makes for a great lunch date! sVkbfLcg75GWnLAmxwMeGQ.text: The Pho here is fantastic! My usual is the pho with meat balls, Spring rolls and two fer Gyoza. I'm usually with my wife or a small group when I eat here. Thy accept cash only but there is an ATM in the establishment. Well lite, clean and very friendly staff your meals are  prepared inside of  an open kitchen surrounded by glass so you can see whats going on in the back. Being a chef myself I love these kind of rooms. So the food. The dish I always go to is the Pho with the little chewy meatballs. Delicious broth. A good amount of noodles. Garnishes are plenty and yup the rosted  satee sauce is right at the table next to the hoisin and siracha, perfect. The ice tea here keeps flowing. I actually jones for this place.

BQmehTURIGumoVONLK5X8Q.text: We were going to give them a try tonight but realized they didn't have their health code grade sign anywhere. When we asked the workers about it, they didn't have it.  They said the health inspectors had not come back yet. ??    It's a shame because we have eaten here before. It was decent but after tonight. No way!

uI5yxDKgKC09yoJPBoP0Kg.text: Vegas has a lot of options for Vietnamese food and I don't have a favorite (yet) but I love Jenni Pho because it's a little bit closer for me than Spring Mountain and it's always good.  I have tried their pho (I always do the build your own so I can pick the meats) and it is pretty solid.   Their rice plates are also a great choice especially for non-pho lovers. The grilled pork and short ribs are my favorite.  They also have other noodle options, beef stew, and oxtail pho (I still need to try).   The restaurant is very clean and the kitchen is visible from the dining room. Service is very friendly and attentive.   Tip: Jenni Pho also has 3 value bentos to choose from and for about 10 bucks my favorite is "Option B" where you can get rice, grilled pork, fried chicken wings, an egg roll, a cup of their delicious broth, and a drink (soda or boba).  Definitely an excellent option for Vietnamese food outside of Spring Mountain.

It's cool cause they have clear glass between the kitchen and the dining area, so you can see the chefs at work.  The server was also reeeaaally nice and attentive.  I was recently recommended the oxtail pho that they recently added to their menu (which I had no idea existed as an option for pho). And I was pleasantly surprised at how good it was!  Ya'll should definitely come and give the place a try.  & I'm not that good at photos but maybe the lighting in the restaurant was just really good or something, idk.  Go and take your selfies .

The plates are a good sized portion at a reasonable price. During the hot summer months, I like to order the vermicelli and pho during the winter. If you're ever in the area and craving Vietnamese food, give them a try you won't be disappointed.

Iyd8twtskjgwvxtq7flj4Q.text: Quite ok pho place but I haven't got a chance to try out other dishes I want to. So far the pho is quite bland to me but the up side is the broth is piping hot which I love. But I have add a bit of sauce to boosted up the taste of the broth other than that the service is very friendly. Really nice ladies.  Milk tea was not that great. Taste just off. But I do like their lemon tea.

_azMhyTDO_Lu6-IetuVTDw.text: Wow i wish i had known about this place sooner! Will definitely be coming back again.  A buddy of mine recommended this place to me and i'm glad I listened. The staff is super friendly and accommodating, Our waiter was always checking up on us and refilling our waters, My 2 friends ordered the supersize Pho and boy was it big and delicious! I myself got one of the combination dishes, it consisted of grilled skewer pork, grilled shrimp, egg rolls, and brown rice, 10/10 for the quality and wow they cook fast!  I was also surprised to find thai iced tea on the menu which is a plus for me because I'm always in the mood for it!  Overall I will be coming back for sure and highly recommend this place to others!

photos.caption: Photo of Jenni Pho - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled skewer pork with grilled shrimp, brown rice, and spring roll.  Thai Iced tea

AKQJ3KhJhOHm54sk3xoLEA.text: Introduction:  It's a super cold night so I crave a bowl of Pho.  Ran into Jenni Pho and decided to give it a shot. Man, am I glad I gave it a shot. Here's why........  Customer Service: 5/5 Super friendly waitresses, from the moment you walk in till the time we left the restaurant.   Quality: 5/5 One word, YUMMY! We had the Pho Bento plate and the BBQ pork and egg roll vermicelli.  Both, were equally amazing.  One of the best fish sauce I've ever had (not so fishy) & also, the best egg rolls.    The egg rolls were super crunchy and doesn't have a funky smell to them, like some of the ones I had at other Pho restaurants.   Quantity: 5/5 I had the Bento plate, which comes with a bowl of  Pho, a side of BBQ pork, 2 pieces of fried wontons, an egg roll (I ate it all, felt like a pig) and ice cream.    My friend had the BBQ pork and egg roll vermicelli bowl.  Both orders had amazing portions, but we ate them all cause they were exceptional.  Price: 5/5 The Bento was only $12.99, as you can see, what comes with it as I mentioned above for only $12.99 is OUTSTANDING.  Cleanliness: 5/5 Unlike some typical Pho restaurants, this place was immaculate.  Atmosphere: 5/5 Super cozy, comforting and accommodating. Makes you feel really welcome as a customer. Sorry to say, but for an Asian restaurant, it's rare.  Tips: I love Jenni Pho, our new Pho place to go. We will definitely be back. Everything on the menu was super inexpensive.

DAHc0gAqXFDWYEXmWDLBoQ.text: Shetty Hard boba Decent service, they are very nice and work hard. But can't own up to a mistake.  Raw chicken - Good pho

Y3IXJLcpnERfZo_jhwgaDw.text: Very good pho here don't have to go to China town big portion, fresh vegetable perfect broth.

mu_6rzoXJ4ldltaLzsQ07g.text: When you're in the mood for some warm and delicious soup, Jenni pho is the right place for you. My favorite is P11 or Create your own bowl, which you can order pho with the choice of any beef up to 5 combinations. I always get the tendons, tripe and brisket. Parents get the Super size traditional Jenni pho to share with. Broth was fresh, hot and flavorful. They charged $1 for extra broth. Service were excellent and friendly staffs. Would recommend fresh spring rolls with peanut sauce for appetizer.

q0E8frxaVrk30pHOVqkFFg.text: Jenni Pho gets a solid 3.5 stars! Rounding up because I had a positive overall experience.  - $8 - $9 for a large bowl of pho - Plenty of vermicelli noodles, however, not so generous with the meat portions ($2 additional if you want extra meat)  - Brisket was on point! hQYPlHK13abKj6na-Bfb2w.text: Portion was great! Man, if you want quality and quantity this is the spot. As a stingy and cheap person I don't like spending money. But hoocheemama, if these prices aint the best prices I've seen here in a while. Pleasing experience.

I_6XpwhEv0-DyW0WpVdFBw.text: BS +++  Pho! Pho! Phonomenal! First of, the  server was nice and quick! I ordered and within 3 minutes my food was on the table.  When I mean quick I mean QUICK! 7SGUDcdiQdy5QEZ0uGmpQA.text: Coming from SF Bay Area, I've been in the search for real authentic Vietnamese Food! I'm so thankful to find this gem. FYesIDxJmm2xzV3FpVxFdg.text: I am half Lao and Black so I have High expectations to taste! Especially the authenticity of Pho since I grew up eating it! hzb1mWDtuvuCCAypt8L2pw.text: Located on rainbow and windmill/robindale in SW i like this place near home. Open from 10am to 10pm. All the staff is very pleasant and helpful.  I always order meat ball pho and some egg rolls. for 2 pho and some egg rolls you are looking for $25

yVsmY8qfxcsVLQh1pzydEA.text: The pho here was very good and the presentation was awesome. The staff here is very friendly. It's a little pricier than most pho places but it was well worth it.

hzIag_nPlYh4pChB8CQ-HA.text: I love the soup! This is medicine after a bad crackout or a hangover. I really like how the soup stays hot and flavorful. The waiters are really nice and friendly and pay very much close attention to their customers. Vmci9_dfsmzn_xA8IG-JwA.text: We always drive across town to Pho kim long for our pho cravings. But Jenni Pho, being so conveniently located near home -- we had to try it. We ordered our usual order so that we could compare the two places. Springs rolls, charbroiled pork chops, and a beef ball and brisket combo pho.  Each of jenni pho's dishes fell short in taste in comparison to kim long's. Having tasted kim long's food the dishes at jenni's were a little bland. Peanut sauce was runny, spring rolls weren't fresh, vermicelli overcooked. I do give them points for great customer service. They lose points in being a "cash only" establishment.

Photo of Jenni Pho - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ball &amp; brisket pho

-IR_5PNBHyAXoROCTOdRiQ.text: I've heard from friends that Jenni Pho has the best Thai Tea in town. And since its right down the street from my house, its 1000x more convenient than driving all the way to Pho So 1 on Spring Mountain ( my usual pho spot ).   The restaurant is fairly small but well-decorated and well-lit with natural light. Generally speaking, asian food joints aren't the nicest places to eat. But I was pleasantly surprised to see that Jenni Pho is actually a really nice sit down restaurant.   In addition to pho, the menu features a variety of delicious appetizers and entrees for those who aren't pho people. My favorite bowl of pho is Pho Dac Biet which is their "Jenni Pho" so I went with that and an order of fresh spring rolls. The spring rolls were absolutely delicious: soft noodles, crisp vegetables, fresh shrimp. Definitely one of the better spring rolls I've had. But the peanut sauce was a little bit thick for my liking. So I added some soy sauce and sriracha to it to tone down the strong peanut flavor and thin the consistency a bit.   The server's timing was very good as well. I was halfway done with my spring rolls and he brought the pho to the table. I was immediately disappointed to see that all of the "rare beef" was fully if not over cooked. Next time I'll be ordering the beef on the side; I prefer my beef more rare than well-done. Pho Dac Biet doesn't usually come with meatballs. And nothing against Jenni Pho but I've just never been a big fan of Asian meatballs so I removed those from my bowl. Despite my issues with the meats, I still enjoyed this bowl of pho. The broth was very flavorful and it satisfied my craving.   Before I left, I got a Boba Thai Tea to go. WHICH WAS AWESOME AND CHEAP.  I can see Jenni Pho becoming one of my usual spots to eat. Overall, the pho was just OK. But I did enjoy my meal. And its so close to my home that I just can't pass it up.

photos.caption: Photo of Jenni Pho - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jenni Pho (Pho dac Biet) &amp; Spring Rolls all washed down with a Thai Tea

RnR3CswsrHXEuCTIBbzGAQ.text: Ate lunch here today and it was delicious!! The noodles were wonderful and we will be back! Our server was friendly, but I would not come to this restaurant if I were in a hurry. The only real con is that they do not take cards, it's cash only. Food was worth it though!

wfVte5_dIk2-ElqRiyhW6Q.text: Not bad pho. A little slow out of the kitchen and they kinda skimped on the basil but were more than happy to bring more. At 2pm on a Thursday only 3 tables were open. We liked the build your own pho. Very fresh. We'll be back for more.  As for other reviews about the staff, the crew today was very polite and extremely attentive. As soon as they realized I drink a LOT of water they were there before I emptied my glass.

HK4pfsJiRNT5aU7wOVlVkw.text: When you walk in you're immediately greeted with the savory smell of the food being cooked in the kitchen. Not soon after you're greeted by whoever is working and seated right away. My friend and I got spring rolls to start and we each ordered pho. Everything was so fresh and so delicious! I'm very critical of the broth in my pho and Jenni Pho hit the nail on the head! Overall this place gets 4 stars, 2 for the very attentive service and 2 for the delicious food. If they weren't cash only this place would be 5 stars easily. I'll definitely be back!

DwXs1WA95v4LaUAxoN9xJg.text: This is the original location where Jennipho first started its legend, and I can see why it has successfully expanded. The ambiance here is relaxing and feels a little more "homey" and warm versus the second location. You can feel all of the love and effort this family owned business puts into their restaurant as soon as you walk through the door. Their wonderful service is consistent each time we come here. The delicious pho broth never changes and always serves to satisfy our pho expectations. Always order the crab rangoons for appetizer and if you haven't yet, you have to try the bun bo hue! They DO NOT take cash so remember to bring cash if you mind ATM fees. The commotion will be worth it. We love Jennipho!

QbqOmzBMC97Y1LPuvMLk2A.text: So Annoyed with this place. I waited a few days to gather my thoughts before I left a review, because I didn't want my frustrations dictate my views. This is the second time I have placed an order (in person) and the second time it was given to me incorrectly. The first time I ordered 3 meals and a few side orders, I didn't bother checking the bag since it seemed so heavy. It was a $40 dollar order mind you-_-. When I arrived at the house, I noticed the third meal was not there and I called. The receipts they give you doesn't have the items ordered, they only have the total amount. Which is even more frustrating because the burden is on me to prove what I ordered matches the price. The lady on the phone basically challenged everything I said and so I just let it go. I didn't have time to argue with her. Fast forward 7 months and figured I give it a try again. I ordered Honey chicken (4 meals total), egg rolls, Taro smoothy and even pointed with my beautiful finger right over the name. The girl taking my order even repeated it back to me and so I paid an almost $70 price tag. I waited for about 20 min and the girl didn't seem too excited to be there, mostly checking her phone and looking around before deciding to make the smoothy. When I get the order I make sure to check everything and what do I see??? A sunny side up egg plopped on top of porkchop and rice. So I begin to question the guy who brought the food and when the girl (who took my order) noticed me questioning things, she came right over and crouched down to eye level while I sat dumbfounded on the chair. She looked right at me and stated..." You ordered C6 which is a porkchop, don't you remember what you order"? It took Every ounce of effort to not lose it. Am I not the customer here? Since my debit card had already been charged and I didn't want to end up on the news, so I simply decided to be the bigger person and just leave. With the food of course. Never will I ever go back to this place ever again. The food and hassle is not worth it.

mO63E-M8Vk5j9ppLtztIRw.text: Not the worst but not that great either. My veggies were fresh and tofu was tasty but the broth had little flavor and too much salt. The jalapenos served on side were old and when asked for basil we were told that all of Vegas was out of basil.   They have a small sign on the side of the entrance door thst says cash only.  Vegas has better pho to offer that doesn't cost me an extra bowl in atm fees.

u0sd08uBCR5pA0fPy_0HkQ.text: Came here for lunch with a friend. His first time here. Steady lunch crowd. We both had cold noodles. My friend's comment was that he liked how light his lunch was. Very filling but not stuffed. I like that you can see into the kitchen through glass. I like seeing how clean places are. We both liked our lunches and we both will definitely be back. Cold noodles no soup is a nice change from regular pho.  Also had fried egg rolls. Greens and sauces were fresh

TtppjCmJaHYV9Xj8e7qpeQ.text: I started coming to this place a few years back and I just came in tonight and I am really disappointed. The food used to be so much better.  Hopefully it was just an off night, but I don't think so.. :(

a_8NGW6i13IMqqCSRrVGAQ.text: I don't know what all of the complaining is about. Food was fast. Soup was hot. Everything was amazing. I'm so glad I didn't listen to the bad reviews and gave this place a shot. No disappointment here. Will be back!

3Utbf84XhkQl48yvWGYrYA.text: When I dined in here I didn't have a bad experience so I thought I would try getting take out from this location and I was extremely disappointed.   I ordered bun bo hue and egg rolls. A pretty simple order that I've gotten from other Vietnamese restaurants before. It took them over 30 mins to get my order together and the excuse I got was... "It takes a while to heat up the bun bo hue". Its soup.. It doesn't take that long to heat up soup.   It took so long that two people who came in after I did and ordered take out got their food before I did.   Needless to say I will not be returning to this restaurant anytime soon.

B1SesuZXw_jEQhyzKo377w.text: No complaints!, Service was good, food was great! I ordered the pho with chicken (&1.00 extra ) for the white meat, the meal was huge, couldn't finish it! Prices very reasonable! My daughter ordered the "Broken Rice" dish with pork skewers, which she also loved!! We will definitely return to Jenni Phos, our new go to place for lunch!

fhqW70LGoCUZyyCevmSr-Q.text: I ordered large pho today for lunch.  This dish cost 15.13?  Never had this high cost pho before.  Also the menu didn't mention the large size pho cost nor the waitress told me how much it cost when I ordered.  Food was okay but not $15.13 worth.

WphlJlK5n0rtAUsprq3vRw.text: Not bad for a pho place, speaking that it's so close to, definitely my to go spot if i don't feel like going to China town.
